The University of Cincinnati is looking for ways to tighten its financial belt for the coming fiscal year but campus police wont be getting the axe PERIOD

The UC Board of Trustees has asked each department of the university to come up with plans to restructure their respective budgets to become more financially viable PERIOD

Every department in the university has been asked to compose a plan to help cut spending said UC Spokesman Greg Hand PERIOD Each plan would then be presented to the Board of Trustees for them to make a decision and subsequently implement the aforementioned budgets. the Board of Trustees will most likely discuss the university budget in a meeting Tuesday June  in the Russell C PERIOD Myers Alumni Center and in said meeting each department would unveil their respective moneysaving plan Hand said PERIOD

One key budget proposal in its early planning phase involves the restructuring of UCs Public Safety office PERIOD

I plan to restructure the force in a way that improves a sense of safety said Michael Cureton chief of the UC Police Division and director of Public Safety PERIOD

The universitys budgetplanning phase is in its infancy and its too early to describe or discuss any specifics about Public Safety restructuring or any other cuts that might occur in other departments Hand said PERIOD

Public Safetys reorganization would not include layoffs of police officers or reduction in any section that might affect the safety of the university community Cureton said PERIOD

Money for the university budget comes from  percent donor support  percent tuition and fees and only  percent

state support PERIOD

With state support decreasing the university is forced to look for other ways to save money PERIOD Consequently each university department will see funding cut in some way or another PERIOD
